website_summaries.verdict: Simple design in an inexpensive cable puller that’s perfect for jobs where you don’t need a lot of pulling power.
pros: One-handed operation is convenient for small jobs
Sturdier construction than you might expect at this price
Handles are coated with plastic to help you maintain your grip
Perfect tool for working on brake lines, preventing fraying
cons: May struggle to control thin diameter cables with this tool

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the one I lost- but it works with some effort
customer_reviews.text: This is the second cable tightener I've owned. I bought one about 20 years ago from Performance Bikes and it was super easy to use. This one works, but not terribly well. I found it difficult to latch onto the flat part of the zip ties and hold on. It takes more finagling to get the job done. It was less expensive than others, and had I had a continuous use for it I would have returned it for a better, more expensive version. I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: VincentTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Look Mom No Hands.
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why I have not bought this sooner. It makes changing brake cables a breeze, seconds versus minutes and no more honey can you help me tighten this bolt conversations. Works as expected. Wouldn't use on derailers, which you can tighten down easily with pliers. But did have issue with fraying some shift cables when I wasn't paying attention to see if the cable was engaged in the puller. Overall great tool. Again, I think this is an exact copy of the park tool version just cheaper. Although I wouldn't trust a replica bike frame, I would trust a replica tool.
customer_reviews.author: PdxCt

customer_reviews.title: Winner winner for the price
customer_reviews.text: Didnt want to spend a lot of $$ for a tool that gets used 2 -3 times a year. But I got sick and tired of pulling on the cable and then trying to tighten bolts at the same time. This tool does the job well and for the price compared to the industry leader, this is a winner. If your on a budget or just dont want to spend lot's of your hard earned money then this is the tool for you. Dollar for dollar this is a winner. I would have given it 5 stars if you can make fine click moves with the thumb lever but it doesnt, so thats why I give it only 4.
customer_reviews.author: Ramir

customer_reviews.title: Easiest way to shred a cable I’ve ever seen.
customer_reviews.text: Such a promise! I had two cables to replace when this arrived, and it does deliver on pulling and keeping the cable taut is met... two times out of five. Two out of five? When I was only replacing two cables? The other three times it shredded the cable and I had to try again with a fresh cable. It seems that under tension the cables pull behind the clamp, which is too small for it, so they shred. If the tool was assembled with less gap or play between the swinging arm and the main body, I bet this would be amazing. As it is, I’m not pleased with this and don’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Worked ok, but there is better
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed that this tool damages the cable when using. Also, it found it slipped a few times if you didn't get the cable just perfect in the jaws. It did work and it did pull the cable tight for installation, but it did damage and flatten the cable which could make putting a cable end cap on difficult depending on where you wanted to cut the cable length. I found myself just pulling the cable by hand to pre-tension the shift cables in the derailleur.
customer_reviews.author: zinalia martel

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but a workhorse so far!
customer_reviews.text: I repair and restore bikes for a local Children's Home/Shelter. Bike after bike has broken or missing cables. I can't speak for this tool's long term durability as I've only had it a few days, but I've used it on several bikes this week and it works like a champ. I especially like the locking feature which allows me to work with both hands. Probably not the same "build quality" as a high dollar Park, but even if I only get a year or two out of it, I can buy another one and still come out cheaper. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Joe F

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a third/fourth hand tool to complement my bicycle repair tool box. Of course everyone wants a Park Tool, but that's champagne price on beer salary. This works as well !! For the few times you are going to use this specialized tool, why not. I have used it three times, interestingly enough working on my buddies bikes not mine. So they like me because I have the tool?!?!?!
customer_reviews.author: Cycling Bear

customer_reviews.title: Functional but design flaws
customer_reviews.text: This tool is functional enough but has quite an aggressively serrated edge where it grips the cable and I've frayed a couple of cables, probably because of this. It's very similar to the Pedro's product in this regard, but some of the competition (e.g. Park, Hozan) seems to depend solely on compression and does away with serration for gripping the cable, and so I may check it out.
customer_reviews.author: decisivemoment

customer_reviews.title: Not good for shifter cable
customer_reviews.text: This "4th Hand" puller frayed and then severed my brand new shift cable. This is because the gripping mechanism pinches the cable at a single point on a broad serration tooth, and the mechanism in general is poorly built with thin metal parts. The positive reviews seem to be for the thicker brake cables, but this device does not work well for the thinner shift cables.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The service was very quick and Ice Toolz Fourth Hand Cable Puller works like a charm and is worth every penny - I don't see a reason to paying much more for the same tool from a different brand. I don't have it long enough to talk about durability but the tool looks like it's made to last. I recommend to anyone who's working on bikes.
customer_reviews.author: REL99

customer_reviews.title: Works great, half the price
customer_reviews.text: The tool works well though it appears somewhat cheap. You can use this on any cable controlled device - bike brakes, derailleurs, car throttles and kickdowns, etc. Great price compared to other manufacturers. It's a luxury since you can do the work without this tool, but it makes adjustments take 5 minutes instead of 10-15.
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingB

customer_reviews.title: Took some time to align it properly but it works
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my mountain bike tuning up my front derailleur. My hands are not sufficient to pull the cable to the right tautness. I actually over tightened the cable but it was easy to ease off the tension. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Helps tension bicycle cables. Yeah, I know there ...
customer_reviews.text: Helps tension bicycle cables. Yeah, I know there are tensioning tricks that don't require any tools, and yeah I know that the industry is going towards electronic shifting and hydraulic braking. But at this price, it's worth having one.
customer_reviews.author: Harris Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Great Third hand
customer_reviews.text: It took me a minute to figure out how it works by looking at the pictures on the back but, once I got the hang of it I was a believer. It makes you feel like a professional.
customer_reviews.author: MulyCat

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I don't know how to use it but it seems pretty straight forward. It just didn't help. Part of the issue is the construction of this tool the bit that retains the ratchet is not spring loaded so in order to keep the cable locked while tightening, you must hold the tool with the handles up otherwise the clippy slides free and you are no longer locked. All in all this tool required two hands instead of giving me the free hand I needed to do the job. It was just easier to do it the hard way pulling the cable by hand.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mefford

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Unless you do a ton of bike work, this will cover your needs as a home mechanic. I accidentally dropped mine on day 1 and it got bent and now doesn't open very smoothly but if you're more careful or less clumsy than I am it will probably last.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Identical to the more expensive brands
customer_reviews.text: I examined this IceToolz version against the Park Tool model side by side and did not see any difference. It also looks the same as the Pedro version (looking at photos on the web). Unless you are a tool label snob, why pay more? (This from an ex-pro mechanic with a large roll-away filled with Snap-On and Matco tools, but also a few select Harbor Freight items.) I have used the tool once when changing a disc brake cable and it worked fine. Noticed a slight deformation of the cable when gripped by the cam, but it was not excessive and is to be expected. Nice to have this in my box of specialty bike tools.
customer_reviews.author: Thetaguy

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: I always prefer Park Tools, but can’t afford all my tools to be that brand. This is a very good replacement. Built up a bike and had no problems at all. Highly recommended, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Be patient and title work fine.
customer_reviews.text: Good enough, but be patient. Just a bit flimsy. Won’t work well for constant use, but then again, that’s why a shop will spend more money. For a DIY bike guy like me it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works Reasonably Well
customer_reviews.text: Locks easily in place worked well for tightening derailleur wire, actually makes it easy to over tighten the wire. The release can be a little fiddly but definitely effective enough for the few times a home DIY mechanic will need it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hilt

customer_reviews.title: good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: This item work very well as intended. didn't really have any issue with how it function and it is much cheaper than the name brand part.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: You need to pay attention that the cable is fed perfectly straight (and there is plenty of room for it not to be) if you want to
customer_reviews.text: I agree with most the points brought up in the negative reviews: 1 - The part which grips the cable is overly narrow. You need to pay attention that the cable is fed perfectly straight (and there is plenty of room for it not to be) if you want to ensure a good grip on the cable. 2 - It is quite easy to lock the fourth hand so tight that it's near impossible to release the lock. 3 - There's enough play in the cable gripping jaws that it's too easy to get the cable stuck between.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after only a few uses
customer_reviews.text: The design of a Fourth Hand Tool is clever and necessary for working on your bike. Definitely get one. This IceToolz one was pretty cheap and works ok. I like the locking mechanism that lets me tension the cable then let go of the tool to check tension before tightening the locking bolts. One major downside is that this tool started rusting after only about 2 or 3 light uses. It still works but sticks so I have to use two hands to get it to lock onto the cable before starting the pulling. Bottom line is that it's cheap so don't expect quality from this particular brand.
customer_reviews.author: JDF

customer_reviews.title: Either struggle with the tool or struggle with the cable, job still tough.
customer_reviews.text: Clever tool and it works as designed but still need a bit of holding your tongue just right to get the goldilocks brake adjustment
customer_reviews.author: R Dan Pauley

customer_reviews.title: I Would Have Rated Higher If I Could
customer_reviews.text: They work exactly as stated and just as well as the pair that was three times more expensive. When I read some of lower ratings I thought for the price I would try them. I am very glad I purchased. Easy to use, super value, and comfortable grip.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Product was good
customer_reviews.text: Product good, delivery people left on back porch which is not covered in the rain, package was soaking wet.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. White

customer_reviews.title: Beats the Competition!
customer_reviews.text: No need to purchase the other brands that charges 2 to 3 times than this tool that does the job done as described.
customer_reviews.author: Lonely Planet

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have it
customer_reviews.text: If you do any cable work on bikes this is a great tool to have. Very affordable and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: sgtfury83

customer_reviews.title: Great for zip ties
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a dedicated zip tie poehler and it broke on the first use this item works great for that purpose
customer_reviews.author: J. Q. Chen

customer_reviews.title: A cyclists must have tool
customer_reviews.text: These work fantastic. I always struggled trying to stretch the cables on my own but these make it super easy. Wish I would have bought them sooner. Also, I can't really see any real difference between these and the much more expensive versions.
customer_reviews.author: Mondo

customer_reviews.title: Less cursing. What's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: Another tool that I wish I would have purchased when I first started wrenching on bikes. Saves me from having to grab a family member and curse under my breath all the time in order to get the brakes dialed in.
customer_reviews.author: colin

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool. Keeps my bike "fleet" brakes adjusted easily, gears too
customer_reviews.text: Such an awesome tool. Easy to use. Sure it takes a couple tries to figure out the best way to use it, but it's smooth sailing after that. I just shake my head at the people who gave this tool 3 stars because they had trouble figuring out the proper way to use it. Compared to any other way of adjusting brake cables... there is no comparison. It makes routine adjustments simple and fast. I used to hate trying to adjust bike brakes and derailleur cables. Now it's child's play. If you work on your own bikes... buy one already.
customer_reviews.author: TwelveWeeksInAYear

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: It worked exactly as hoped I’m so glad I got it, I was able to perfectly adjust my brakes they work better than when I got the bike. I couldn’t be more pleased
customer_reviews.author: Sato Itsuki

customer_reviews.title: learning your never to old
customer_reviews.text: not for heavy duty work or if your an avid biker,get the stronger one
customer_reviews.author: Jen San

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This works well for bikes and for scooter clutch cables. It will not work for heavier brake cables that are 1.9mm in thickness.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Landvoigt

customer_reviews.title: Ok for home bike mechanic
customer_reviews.text: Good tool for the price. Ok for general bike work at home.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Clark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and a 'must have'
customer_reviews.text: While other brands perform the same function, this one at its price point fit the bill to assemble a basic bike repair kit without breaking the bank. I have had the tool for 2 days and it has been used on 6 different bikes, all with the same result. This tool allows me the precision I need to keep crisp shifting and braking. Simple to use, sturdy and dependable. I look forward to years of service with this top notch tool.
customer_reviews.author: Paulus Maximus

customer_reviews.title: As Good as you need
customer_reviews.text: I thought about buying a more expensive model but decided on this. I'm glad I did, these work perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Made building this bike a lot easier!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must for installing new cables. I could get the tension right on first try. Love the locking mech on the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A Nickels

customer_reviews.title: Good value, would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: product as described, fair price and good value for the money, fast shipping, would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: 31NDUN

customer_reviews.title: Cycle tool 4th hand
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised. Minimal instructions, but not too hard to figure out. In my experimenting, first use, I used it with too much pressure on my rear shifter cable, and frayed the cable at that point of gripping. So, use it gently at first. I sense it is probably not needed on shifters, but may be more useful for brake cable setting where more tension is needed. I am a weekend cyclist -- I am not sure I would recommend it as needed for an amateur's tool kit.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should!
customer_reviews.text: Not much to review, other than it works the way it should :)
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: get this tool if you maintain your own bike!
customer_reviews.text: If you do your own bike maintenance, this tool should be next on your list after your hex wrenches. I'd been using pliers for the longest time, and that would just mangle the cables. Mangled cables are a headache to tune because they stretch differently than a straight cable. After using this tool, I found that adjusting my derailleurs got much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality.  Compact size.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product, especially for those with medium and smaller hands. My first tool from IceToolz, and ended up buying more.
customer_reviews.author: fotosapien

customer_reviews.title: Frustration eliminator
customer_reviews.text: I had put off buying one of these for years because the ones I had seen were too expensive for a job not done very often. I learned about the Icetoolz model and I couldn't resist buying it at its price. I am not disappointed. This tool will make a frustrating job very easy. The quality appears quite adequate for home use and the tool has a quality "feel" to it. My only regret is that I didn't learn about it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: BobV

customer_reviews.title: does the job easily and effectively
customer_reviews.text: Did the job exactly as I needed it to. Made adjusting my derailleur a snap!
customer_reviews.author: troy smith

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and effective
customer_reviews.text: My favorite thing about this is the price! It performs every bit as well as the Park and Pedro's version but cheaper. Oh yeah, the slim design slides into the exterior pocket of my bike tool bag:p
customer_reviews.author: Kdub

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for amateur use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and holds cables securely. This will probably last the average person a lifetime if you don't abuse it.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Good tool just needs more design
customer_reviews.text: This tool WILL work for you, BUT a couple of changes could make this tool perfect. 1 needs a stronger spring. 2 the handle on the top should be flat not the edge it is currently. 3 the wire will get caught in the tool. 4. the lock piece just gets in the way.... While this tool works try the Hozan it will do even better for you and it will feel more comfortable in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R. Swiderski

customer_reviews.title: good tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this since I started working in a bike shop this spring and didn't want to borrow someone else's. It works great as a "fourth hand" as it has a lock so that it will hold itself in position so that you don't have to handle it once it is set. It is not quite as robust as the Park tool in weight and quality of metal but, I've used it several months now nearly daily and has no signs of wear. Good tool.
customer_reviews.author: dibbs

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful tool for maintaining tension on derailleur cables when replacing cables or replacing derailleurs. Its a simple design and beats the alternative use of pliers and trying to tighten a hex bolt at the same time. True you may not use this often, but the cost is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Works well - Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: After destroying way too many cables with vise grips or pliers, I broke down and bought this cable puller. It works well and compared to others, is a good value!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You need this tool.
customer_reviews.text: And when you start using it ask yourself why it took you so many years to own a tool like this. This will make your bicycle maintenance a lot easier and although you can get by without it, this tool really does make cable adjustments so much easier. I'm sure there are higher quality tools for this purpose but it does a fine job. Who came up with the name "IceToolz"? They need a better marketing department.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance

customer_reviews.title: As good as the Park and 1/3 the price
customer_reviews.text: I lost my fourth hand... somewhere in the garage. I went to Performance and they had the Park Tool for 46 dollars. This one was about $15.00 And, I can't tell the difference. And, get one, it is absolutely perfect for setting cable tension.
customer_reviews.author: HomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: ... on the cheaper and and it has been working great for
customer_reviews.text: This tool is basically 2d but it is on the cheaper and and it has been working great for me
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Calvani

customer_reviews.title: This is definitely worth the money. After struggling for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely worth the money. After struggling for a couple of hours and fraying a derailleur cable beyond repair - I ordered this tool (and a new cable). Fitting and tightening the new cable was a breeze, when using this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Reluctant Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: I did test try this tool just to see if ...
customer_reviews.text: I did test try this tool just to see if I could grip the break cables, it did but other than that I have no use for them yet. Into the tool box for now.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL WILSON

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done at a pretty good price. Takes a little bit of fiddling to get the cable caught into the pinch area, but wouldn't want to go back to tightening brakes without it.
customer_reviews.author: ProgRock Freak

customer_reviews.title: Came very quickly in good packaging. As advertised and is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Came very quickly in good packaging. As advertised and is easy to use. The only problem I have with the item is the lock which seems to fall into lock place without my putting it there. But am happy with items overall and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M. Wickre

customer_reviews.title: Item seems to work as described. I'm still having ...
customer_reviews.text: Item seems to work as described. I'm still having a problem adjusting my brakes, but this tool will me to correct it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Kline

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely made, very useful tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made tool that makes cable actuated bicycle brakes and shifters much easier to adjust... It works as well as much the much costlier ones used by professional bike mechanics but may not be a rugged.. Even the pro stuff breaks if abused so be kind to your tools and use them correctly.
customer_reviews.author: W. DeFord

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten a pair years ago
customer_reviews.text: I can now adjust brakes quickly, instead of fighting cables and pliers. No poked fingers on old cable and no fraying of new cables. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie RoanTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Gave as gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift. It arrived quickly. It appears to meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for canti brakes
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. An absolute must for canti brakes. Makes life so much easier. I always dreaded having to mess with my brakes because it was such a PITA but with these it's a piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A non-Park product that works!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this several times with no problems. It was inexpensive AND it works. Maybe not for a shop but definitely good for home or occasional use. I replaced both of my shifters and boy did this make life easier. Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Gunslinger69

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Locking mechanism is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Not a ton to say, it works and is cheap. Locking mechanism works great so that I can let go of the tool while I lock the cable down
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Very, very helpful. What I needed. Wasn't sure if it was gonna work with the kind of brakes I had. Sure did work. Now I don't have to bring it into a shop and pay labor. Tool seems quality enough to do it's job. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have. Adjusting the front\rear derailleur was a piece of cake. Great tool
customer_reviews.author: Will's Way

customer_reviews.title: Cable adjustments are buttery smooth!.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have gotten this years ago. Makes fine tuning brakes/derailleurs a breeze. Don’t sleep on the price either!!
customer_reviews.author: REYDIO

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Never used the Park but this tool doesn't make me want to. Makes setting up the calipers on my vintage MB easy. Good for derailleurs too.
customer_reviews.author: Willie the Shake

customer_reviews.title: The cable holding jaw is a bit fiddly.
customer_reviews.text: Works reasonably well except it is difficult getting the jaws to catch the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Goose

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. Feels a bit cheap. Enough play ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Feels a bit cheap. Enough play in the mechanism that cable can slip behind grabber.
customer_reviews.author: Trophy Husband

customer_reviews.title: Pulls like a horse
customer_reviews.text: Good price and it pulls cable. Not sure why you'd buy one that's twice the price but if you do I guess you like to blow money.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for the price
customer_reviews.text: This tool works well for what it is intended to do .I also purchased the Park Tool BT-2.The Ice Toolz is lighter in weight,but does the job.I take this tool on the road whenever I travel because of its lighter weight and keep the Park Tool BT-2 at home in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed and a great price compared to other tools
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed and a great price compared to other tools. Well made and should hold up especially for a DYI user. I have never purchased any Ice Tools prior and bought 3 at a time. All well priced and solid tools and I'm a Craftsman / Snap-on in the rollaway guy.
customer_reviews.author: DJD

customer_reviews.title: Handy Tool for the DIYer
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bicycle DIYer, and I was hesitant to get one of these. Now, I can really see how it's useful for installing cables (both thicker brake cables and thinner derailleur cables). Decent price too for this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Sweet tool for anything with a cable where you need ...
customer_reviews.text: Sweet tool for anything with a cable where you need to set tension. If you work on bikes, get one, you'll love it. This is cheaper than some and does a great job, lightweight but looks like it'll last forever if you treat it well.
customer_reviews.author: isiton?

customer_reviews.title: Bike Hand Cable Puller
customer_reviews.text: Works great and costs less than at the bike store
customer_reviews.author: Ye Olde Road Warrior

customer_reviews.title: park who
customer_reviews.text: these will do the job they are fairly well made and considering the price they are a great option for the home mech basically they will easily do the same job as the more pricey ones and if you are having to be money conscious and have a need these fit the bill
customer_reviews.author: tekwiz47

customer_reviews.title: Give'm a try
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool, but doesn't work great for vespa clutch cables.
customer_reviews.author: T. Y.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: If you are assembling a lot of bikes, this thing will save your hands!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Imhoff

customer_reviews.title: Work ok, by designed for left handed people
customer_reviews.text: Works ok, by designed for left handed people, or maybe it's just me.
customer_reviews.author: D. B. Reed

customer_reviews.title: cheap imitation
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tool a few times now and am not too pleased with the performance. If you need to put a lot of strain on the cable it sticks in the jaws. It also crimps the cable at the pinch point. The release is a bit awkward to use. My advice, spend a little more and get the "name brand"
customer_reviews.author: Handyhands Bob

customer_reviews.title: A must have...
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool! It made working on my bike cables so easy! I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: James W. Spangler

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase for its intention. Easy to comprehend instructions. Very quick delivery
customer_reviews.author: R. McCain

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps this tool would be useful for the home mechanic that uses it only now ...
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps this tool would be useful for the home mechanic that uses it only now and again. this tool is very light duty and more often than not, requires fiddling in order for it to grab and hold the cable properly. It is of course substantially cheaper than the Park version but only couple of bucks more gets you the Hozan version which is a very high quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Lava mom

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as pricier versions
customer_reviews.text: Does the job of the much more expensive brands. There are ways to hold brake and shifter cables tight when adjusting them, but none of them work as well as using this dedicated tool.
customer_reviews.author: JoeInTampa

customer_reviews.title: Works on V and Disc Brake adjustments like a charm
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little getting use to but definitely a must have in your tool bag. I've used it countless times for adjusting my brakes on my road and mountain bike. Works on v and disc brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia HayesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Respect your bike
customer_reviews.text: If you ever plan on tuning, or changing any of you cables on your bike. Do yourself and your bike a favor, pick up a pair of these. Right took for the right job.
customer_reviews.author: christopher brown

customer_reviews.title: good investment
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool for the job. Easy to use for a novice user(as I am). Seems they may work a little too good as I no longer have to fiddle with my brakes anymore, the tension is really good now. In my opinion a very good buy .
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Great hand tool.
customer_reviews.text: If you are debating whether to buy this because it costs so much less than the Park Tool version, don't it's good quality and makes the job so much easier to do. Works on Vespa clutch cable too!
customer_reviews.author: Schlitze

customer_reviews.title: Holds the tension, but hard on the cable
customer_reviews.text: I can't compare to more expensive ones, but I found this tool to be just OK. The cable tends to get stuck in the mechanism, making it difficult to release. The resulting fiddling and yanking puts strain on the cable, resulting in annoying kinks and untwisting. This does work better than vise grips, but is maybe a 5$ value.
customer_reviews.author: concorditech

customer_reviews.title: Fouth hand cable puller.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works as advertised. I used to adjust the rear break cable after replacing a rear break that was no long working as well as it should have. Things always are much easier to do when given the proper tools. Couldn't bet the price. Cheaper than Park Tool Fourth Hand Cable Puller. I would recommend this tool to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Glad to Ride

customer_reviews.title: Handy and good value
customer_reviews.text: Great value tool. Avoided buying one of these for years. Finally got one for adjusting the kids’ bikes, should have bought it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: andy dodds

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed how easily this tool crushed the wire cables, breaking individual strands. Created additional problems I didn't need.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Berry

customer_reviews.title: Ice is nice
customer_reviews.text: Great tool 1/2 the price as park tool. The tool is constructed better than the price would lead you to believe . Remember this is not a tool you are going to use every day so it should last a long time. The price is right! Buy it use it go ride keep some $$ in your pocket
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It worked so poorly that I gave it away. My buddy incorporated it into a makeshift lamp for his shop. Clamp ends are too narrow to hold a cable properly; cable kept slipping off . Concept is good but design needs to be reworked.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Browne Jr.

customer_reviews.title: beautiful, top quality tool!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this is a beautiful top of the line tool,it is a must when replacing bicycle cable,make sure you have one of these in your tool box,this one was the cheapest one around,great price!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: mrdebjr

customer_reviews.title: I'm wondering if the Park version works any better?
customer_reviews.text: Cable "lock" slips a bit before use, but pulls well once it holds. I'm wondering if the Park version works any better?
customer_reviews.author: Andy Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Product works great for holding and pulling the wires (though you do ...
customer_reviews.text: Product works great for holding and pulling the wires (though you do have to put a minor amount of effort into ensuring it takes hold by lining everything up) though there's no great way to undo the "lock," as far as i can tell, aside from pushing the grip deeper into the wire, which can cause fraying. Otherwise, product does exactly the job it needs to do at a more than fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

product_meta.title: IceToolz Fourth Hand Cable Puller - Universal Cable Holder with Locking Mechanism
product_meta.description: The product is IceToolz Fourth Hand Cable Puller.
feature_bullets: EASY OPERATION: Incorporated thumb lock to hold the cable tight for one-hand operation. Plastic-coated handles for grip and comfort
DESIGN: Plastic-coated handles for grip and comfort.
COMPATIBILITY: Works on brake and derailleur cables.
PROCESS: Pulls extended inner wire taught inside the housing.
PROTECTION: Keep brake lines tight without fraying or damaging the line.
